commit.commit_title: Change Dockerfile to upgrade packages when building (#26922)

prs.pr_title: Change Dockerfile to upgrade packages when building
prs.pr_body: Also ensure that nightly & release images do not use the Docker cache, so `dist-upgrade` is always ran and we know those images use the latest packages.

prs.pr_body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [sass](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass) | [`1.66.1` -> `1.67.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/sass/1.66.1/1.67.0) | [![age](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/age/npm/sass/1.67.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/adoption/npm/sass/1.67.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/compatibility/npm/sass/1.66.1/1.67.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/confidence/npm/sass/1.66.1/1.67.0?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>sass/dart-sass (sass)</summary>

### [`v1.67.0`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#1670)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.66.1...1.67.0)

-   All functions defined in CSS Values and Units 4 are now once again parsed as
    calculation objects: `round()`, `mod()`, `rem()`, `sin()`, `cos()`, `tan()`,
    `asin()`, `acos()`, `atan()`, `atan2()`, `pow()`, `sqrt()`, `hypot()`,
    `log()`, `exp()`, `abs()`, and `sign()`.

    Unlike in 1.65.0, function calls are *not* locked into being parsed as
    calculations or plain Sass functions at parse-time. This means that
    user-defined functions will take precedence over CSS calculations of the same
    name. Although the function names `calc()` and `clamp()` are still forbidden,
    users may continue to freely define functions whose names overlap with other
    CSS calculations (including `abs()`, `min()`, `max()`, and `round()` whose
    names overlap with global Sass functions).

-   As a consequence of the change in calculation parsing described above,
    calculation functions containing interpolation are now parsed more strictly
    than before. However, all interpolations that would have produced valid CSS
    will continue to work, so this is not considered a breaking change.

-   Interpolations in calculation functions that aren't used in a position that
    could also have a normal calculation value are now deprecated. For example,
    `calc(1px #{"+ 2px"})` is deprecated, but `calc(1px + #{"2px"})` is still
    allowed. This deprecation is named `calc-interp`. See [the Sass website] for
    more information.

    [the Sass website]: https://sass-lang.com/d/calc-interp

-   **Potentially breaking bug fix**: The importer used to load a given file is no
    longer used to load absolute URLs that appear in that file. This was
    unintented behavior that contradicted the Sass specification. Absolute URLs
    will now correctly be loaded only from the global importer list. This applies
    to the modern JS API, the Dart API, and the embedded protocol.

##### Embedded Sass

-   Substantially improve the embedded compiler's performance when compiling many
    files or files that require many importer or function call round-trips with
    the embedded host.

</details>

---

issues.issue_body:
I manually installed on an arm64 (aarch64) machine at bd834add567fc0a0f3960385a7f9abe4324ff212. 

I get a HTTP 500 response when I use the search, the logs says
``` NoMethodError: undefined method `n=' for #<OpenSSL::PKey::RSA:0x00007f900e0910>
Did you mean?  n```

Plus a stacktrace
```
app/services/follow_remote_account_service.rb:42:in `call'
app/services/account_search_service.rb:21:in `call'
app/services/search_service.rb:15:in `call'
app/controllers/api/v1/search_controller.rb:7:in `index'
app/controllers/concerns/localized.rb:24:in `block in set_locale'
app/controllers/concerns/localized.rb:23:in `set_locale'
```

I'm not a Ruby person, but how I see it what is actually crashing is https://github.com/tootsuite/ostatus2/blob/master/lib/ostatus2/magic_key.rb#L8

Now I'm wondering what I broke and why a `OpenSSL::PKey::RSA` should have a `n` field/method at all, because I don't see anything about that in the documentation. 

Any idea what is broken?

* * * *

issues.issue_title: Search API returns 500 internal server error if "max_id" is set
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Sign in to your mastodon.social account on the website, then open this link:
https://mastodon.social/api/v2/search?q=apple&type=statuses&max_id=111065964141901733

2. Without signing in to your account first, open the same link in a private browsing window.

### Expected behaviour

1. Get status code 200, and posts (search results) earlier than the max_id
2. Get status code 401, unauthorized. (optional, 200 is fine imo)

### Actual behaviour

1. Get status code 500: internal server error. No search results.
2. Get status code 200 with no search results.

### Detailed description

API doc: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/search/#v2

This is reproducible on mastodon.social (v4.2.0-nightly.2023-09-13)

Works as expected (status code 200 with search results) when searching a hashtag. e.g. "#apple"

### Mastodon instance

mastodon.social

### Mastodon version

v4.2.0-nightly.2023-09-13

### Technical details

_No response_

commit.commit_title: Fix container build when cache is disabled (#26932)

prs.pr_title: Fix container build when cache is disabled
prs.pr_body: The current action was equivalent to `cache-to: false`, which Docker understood as "cache to the `false` container on the registry", which is not what we want.

prs.pr_body:
Fixes #26731

The decision whether to forward was based on the presence of a JSON-LD signature in the embedded objectâ€¦ but the signature is not on the embedded object but on the root activity.

issues.issue_title: Comment edits not propagating across instances as expected
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

Imagine three users on three instances: User A on Instance A, who is mutually following User B from Instance B, and User C from Instance C who is mutually following with User B.  User A and User C are not following each other at all, nor is anyone from instance C following user A.

So the connection looks like...
A <-> B <-> C
...and there is no connection to User A from Instance C, thus making User A invisible to User C outside of the following interaction...

1. User B makes a post on Instance B.
2. User A responds to post from Instance A, then edits their own comment.
3. User C, from Instance C, from which no one follows user A, looks at post by user A, and sees comment by user B.


### Expected behaviour

Edit from User A should proliferate to instant C, and be visible to user C

### Actual behaviour

Edit from User A does not proliferate to Instance C, so only the original post shows for User C

### Detailed description

As described above, the edit to a comment should be proliferating, but is not.

### Mastodon instance

https://writing.exchange/@raccoon/110976535994429708

### Mastodon version

v4.1.6--ff3

### Browser name and version

Chrome

### Operating system

Android

### Technical details

I think the operative part of this bug is that the post itself is being proliferated to a server which isn't following me, but the edit isn't similarly proliferated, so they see the version with the major typo, without the immediate edit.

issues.issue_title: " TypeError: i.get(...).isEmpty is not a function" at "about/index.jsx"
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. I upgraded the instance to the version 4.2.0-rc1
2. The main site loads but shows a 501 error "isEmpty is not a function" in the web console

### Expected behaviour

open the home site

### Actual behaviour

server error

### Detailed description

I upgraded the instance to the rc-1 and got a error that prevented the services to load (mastodon-streaming) the error was that ioredis was missing, that error was fixed by reinstalling nodeJS, deleting node_modules and re running "yarn install"  when I finally get it to work the site loads but shows this error message:

```
TypeError: i.get(...).isEmpty is not a function
isEmpty (webpack:///app/javascript/mastodon/features/about/index.jsx:164:52)
wi (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:3592:9)

bd (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:5339:57)
bd (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:5336:6)
Error(p (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:5325:19)
Xj (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:5115:84)
lc.onCommitFiberUnmount (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:5136:31)
fa (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:1927:89)
d.hasOwnProperty (webpack:///node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom.production.min.js:4519:386)
```

the same message as [this other issue]( https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/28068) from today

Reinstalling yarn, ruby, node, npm and all packages doesn't change the problem, the error is the same after

### Mastodon instance

laburo.social

### Mastodon version

v4.2.0-rc1

### Browser name and version

firefox and chromium 

### Operating system

debian 9

### Technical details

_No response_

commit.commit_title: Fix crash when viewing a moderation appeal and the moderator account has been deleted (#25900)

prs.pr_title: Fix crash when viewing a moderation appeal and the moderator account has been deleted
prs.pr_body:
Fixes #25899

If the reporting account is deleted, the account_id is nulled by the constraint. However, the view wasn't able to understand that.

issues.issue_title: account_warnings.account_id is nulled when the reporter account is deleted
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

When trying to view the admin page of the account below, an error is generated:

```
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd] ActionView::Template::Error (undefined method `username' for nil:NilClass):
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]      5:         = fa_icon 'warning'
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]      6:     .log-entry__content
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]      7:       .log-entry__title
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]      8:         = t(account_warning.action, scope: 'admin.strikes.actions', name: content_tag(:span, account_warning.account.username, class: 'username'), target: content_tag(:span, account_warning.target_account.pretty_acct, class: 'target')).html_safe
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]      9:       .log-entry__timestamp
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]     10:         %time.formatted{ datetime: account_warning.created_at.iso8601 }
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]     11:           = l(account_warning.created_at)
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd]
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd] app/views/admin/account_warnings/_account_warning.html.haml:8
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd] app/views/admin/account_warnings/_account_warning.html.haml:1
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd] app/views/admin/accounts/show.html.haml:256
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd] app/controllers/concerns/localized.rb:11:in `set_locale'
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd] lib/mastodon/rack_middleware.rb:9:in `call'
[ffc136ca-78d5-49f8-895d-19238e1b94bd] lib/public_file_server_middleware.rb:18:in `call'
```
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/main/app/views/admin/account_warnings/_account_warning.html.haml#L8

Querying the account_warnings table, the reporter ID has been nulled:
```
mastodon=> select id,account_id,target_account_id,created_at from account_warnings where target_account_id=109367766060320746;
 id  | account_id | target_account_id  |         created_at
-----+------------+--------------------+----------------------------
 113 |            | 109367766060320746 | 2022-11-19 03:02:06.634367
 114 |            | 109367766060320746 | 2022-11-19 03:31:17.633006
 110 |            | 109367766060320746 | 2022-11-19 02:41:19.739124
(3 rows)

mastodon=>
```

It appears that the foreign key here nullifies the account_id when the reporting account is deleted

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/main/db/schema.rb#L1163

There are currently 315 warnings WITH a null account_id, and 322 without, so it appears to have been happening for a while, but stopped in feb.

```
mastodon=> select max(created_at), min(created_at) from account_warnings where account_id is null;
            max             |            min
----------------------------+----------------------------
 2023-02-16 06:12:50.031092 | 2022-11-16 09:56:26.437818
(1 row)

mastodon=>
```


### Expected behaviour

Not have crashed

### Actual behaviour

Crashed

### Detailed description

I suspect this was brought upon by running an expire in (I assume) Feburary.

As the constraint explicitly says to null the account_id col, the view should be able to handle account_warning.account being null without crashing.

My workaround for the moment will just be to set the account_id to be target_account_id, but that won't fix it for someone else who runs an expire and then has no idea why they can't see the admin page of random accounts.


### Specifications

v4.1.4

issues.issue_title: Delay email notifications (cause of delete & redraft)
issues.issue_body:
Delete & redraft is a killer feature, but there is one small annoyance. When using email notifications for mentions and someone used delete & redraft, you receive the email 2 or more times. It think the most cases can be solved with queuing and delaying email notifications for ~2 minutes. When a delete & redraft is used, the relevant email notification can then be removed before it's send.

* * * *

- [x] I searched or browsed the repoâ€™s other issues to ensure this is not a duplicate.

issues.issue_title: levels of posting privacy, and maintaining minimum confidentiality possible
issues.issue_body:
this is a lot of big words, but i used them because otherwise i couldnt figure out how to shorten: "minimum privacy possible in reply to private posts, and making sure that the people you are tooting to can see your post in the first place"


basically, we have 3 settings right now, Unlisted, Public, and Private.

at the unlisted level, you can toot to someone who doesn't follow you, and they can see, it

public is also the same, but, it shows up in searches for hashtags if a hashtag is in the toot. also this means anyone can see this toot by looking at your profile

private is only followers


privacy is important, and a way to help secure this is to encourage maximum possible security on replying-to-posts.

IDEALLY: private toots that reply to another private toot would only be visible when someone follows both parties but, that is not enforced currently. 

in the meantime, i suggest the following:

whenever you go to make a reply to a private toot, it defaults to private mode, if you both follow each other. if you DONT follow each other, it defaults to unlisted.

to further help with such things, a related issue is that you cannot tell when someone does not follow you without using the third column, but theoretically, you could run a check whenever there is a @ mention in the toot, and "if they follow you" it will not warn you when you try to reply to them with a private toot, but IF they do not follow you, warn, by changing the color of the reply background to red, maybe, etc. this solves all the issues, and can scale easily into the future.

if #422 comes into existence, the option for privacy level could dissappear for all reply toots, and it would automatically limit who could see the toots to only people who follow both.

other related posts i personally have made, #371, #412

prs.pr_title: Add additional metrics for streaming
prs.pr_body:
This adds two new counters for `redis_messages_received_total` and `messages_sent_total` (per connection type).

Also fixes the initialization of the metrics such that they're zeroed out when the server starts, instead of being undefined, which is recommended as otherwise metrics can [disappear from prometheus](https://prometheus.io/docs/practices/instrumentation#avoid-missing-metrics) between restarts.

Fixes #26940

issues.issue_body:
### Pitch

I've just spoken with a friend who works on prometheus, and he advised me on the two metrics I omitted from the streaming server metrics PR ( I was concerned about implementing without a correct understanding )

The two metrics to add in are:
- total messages sent (by type)
- total messages received off redis

### Motivation

This will gives us better insights into load on the system, as field research has shown me that a lot of Mastodon deployments are not monitoring their redis databases.

@ClearlyClaire / @Gargron I can do up the patch for this tomorrow, as it's about a 20 lines diff at max.

commit.commit_title: Change video bitrate to always fit within size limit (#26970)

prs.pr_title: Change video bitrate to always fit within size limit
prs.pr_body: We calculate the "perfect" bitrate, but also the bitrate that would result in reaching exactly the size limit, and take the lowest one. Shorter videos can therefore maintain a higher quality, while longer ones degrade in quality, but in either case we don't inflate the bitrate above the source material.

issues.issue_body: The /about page when you are not logged in now has a link to the list of apps. The phrase "various apps are available" is now a hyperlink to the list of apps. I would like a more prominent way to promote their existence to a user who has logged in for the first time but I'm not sure how yet so this will do for now.

I'm planning to deploy an instance Mastodon on a small server of my own, but I've heard mixed things about the resources required for Mastodon. 

For a 10-20 user instance, what are the expected/recommended resource allocations? I'm trying to get away with running it on a cheap VPS of some kind, so, around 512MB memory for the entire box.

prs.pr_title: Fix request URL normalisation for bare domain and 8-bit characters
prs.pr_body:
As mentioned in https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26219#issuecomment-1660761265 we need to normalise an empty path to `/`.

I realised that `expect(a_request(:get, 'http://...')).to have_been_made` is not a reliable way to check exactly what was sent over the wire. The URLs are both normalised before being compared, and that defeats the purpose for this test. So I have added tests for `response.request.headline` (.e.g `GET / HTTP/1.1`) instead.

This change to the tests revealed that the new normaliser does not encode 8-bit characters. 8-bit characters are not permitted in URLs according to RFC 3986, but they sometimes occur in user input. They are not permitted raw in the HTTP request line either, so they _must_ be dealt with.

\*sigh* I hope this issue will be fixed in http.rb or Addressable, so we don't have to reinvent this wheel.

prs.pr_title: Do not normalize URL before fetching it
prs.pr_body:
`Request#perform` invokes `Addressable::URI#normalize` on the requested URL, so the HTTP client may end up requesting a slightly different than requested.

This is usually harmless, but it sometimes causes trouble in practice. As mentioned in #14983, link previews for articles on [The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com) have no image. The `og:image` tag on article pages refers to URLs on https://i.guim.co.uk/img/... and includes a query string argument `overlay-align=bottom%2Cleft`. `#normalize` changes this to `overlay-align=bottom,left`, but this breaks the URL.

The behaviour of i.guim.co.uk is unusual, but AFAICT The Guardian does not violate the HTTP 1.1 spec. [RFC 26216 section 3.2.3](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc2616#section-3.2.3) mentions that characters outside the _reserved_ and _unsafe_ may be optionally percent-encoded. `,` is in the _reserved_ set, so I assume it cannot just be percent-encoded/decoded.

In any case, I don't see why a HTTP client should change the URL it is asked to fetch. If we want to fix up e.g. user-provided URLs typed into statuses, I think we should do it elsewhere.

prs.pr_title: Bump version to v4.2.0-rc2
prs.pr_body:
Changes compared to v4.2.0-rc1:

### Added

- Add additional metrics for streaming ([ThisIsMissEm](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26945))

### Changed

- Change video bitrate to always fit within size limit ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26970))

### Fixed

- Fix hashtag bar being sometimes incorrectly hidden ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26960))
- Fix crash when viewing a moderation appeal and the moderator account has been deleted ([xrobau](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/25900))
- Fix Web UI making duplicate search queries when scrolling ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26959))
- Fix error in Web UI when server rules cannot be fetched ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26957))
- Fix `Setting.authorized_fetch` not being properly taken into consideration ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26958))
- Fix post edits not being forwarded as expected ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26936))
- Fix dismiss button overlapping with text in dismissable banners ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26935))
- Fix obsolete cache key in status cache invalidation logic ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26934))
- Fix processing of `min_id` and `max_id` parameters in `/api/v2/search` ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26927))

### Security

- Fix incorrect URL normalization (CVE-2023-42450)
- Fix missing HTML sanitization in translation API (CVE-2023-42452)
- Fix incorrect domain name normalization (CVE-2023-42451)
